experience: You and Andrew both know Mark Masterson, Robin Lowe, and 8 others

- Supervising and providing strategic direction to team of business analysts- Conducting preliminary investigation on project requests for the Arizona Education Data Standards (AzEDS) system- Interfaced with external and internal users to understand and gather requirements for information technology and business program areas- Guidance and coordination of user acceptance criteria to ensure software design and functionality work as intended- Educational data and SaaS based cloud performance analysis

- Arizona Department of Education Information Technology Consultant- Lead business analyst for AzEDS Tier II team- Worked as member of team in utilizing ITIL practices on development and implementation of IT support process for the newly launched educational data standards system, AzEDS.- Acts as a liaison and support between third party student information system vendors, local education agencies, and product management staff.- Certified third party vendors on configuring SaaS systems for submitting educational data to the state through the AzEDS REST API in order to meet the Ed-Fi Data Model.- Analyzing, documenting, and researching educational data support solutions and process improvements within AzEDS REST API, SQL Database, and business data requirements.- Training and managing a team of developers and business analysts.- Performing quality assurance testing to ensure software has fulfilled requirements.

- Strategized, proposed, and assisted with development of an Arizona Department of Education IT website redesign project by combining modern responsiveness with government guidelines and department needs.  - Worked in conjunction with IT Communications to maintain and advance the functionality for the ADE website.

- Development and implementation of business plans and strategies, including finances, service production, cost control, and general management systems.- Accounts receivable, banking, purchasing, personnel, payroll, and internal audits.- Responsible for IT support, including hardware and software systems design for a highly computerized healthcare firm.

recommendations: Business Systems Analysis at Maricopa County

I was very impressed with Andrew Morgan's enthusiasm and professional demeanor when I first met him. He was working at the Department of Education as an intern and was working on a project where he interfaced with my support team.  During the two years I have known Andrew, he has demonstrated an uncanny ability to quickly learn new appliations and technologies and then utilize that knowedge to help assist others.As a Business Analyst, Andrew understands customer committment and concerns. He is able to utilize his many soft skills to effectively elicit customer requirements and document them in a manner that is easy for both the customer and development staff. Andrew is dedicated, reliable and always willing to chip in and lend a hand. Andrew effectively manages his high-volume workload and is excellent at multitasking.  His written reports are always clear, concise and accurate and is able to speak to the information if a question is asked.Andrew is a team player, works well under pressure and with minimal supervision.  He is dedicated to doing a job well and has a commitment to exceeding customer expectations. Andrew is a hardworking, Business Analysis professional. He has my highest recommendation, and would be a great asset to any company.
